 Cloning doesn't set out to make copies of whole humans, it sets out to essentially make copies of organs for transplant, cancer therapy, things like that.

 Maybe your PR campaign isn't effective?
 
 
If the brain dead people can't suffer, and experiments hold the possibility of helping other people end their suffering, then I'm all for it.

 As an evil person (tm) and some exportent posters could attest, I'm for experimenting on live patients...preferably those of an opposing ideology. ;)
 But, that's neither here nor there. We currently simply don't do such a thing *shrugs*
 Might have to do with fears of the slipper slope position...they wouldn't want such done to themselves.
 
 If I were brain dead, then I would be DEAD. I would be proud that my body was being donated to the cause of medical science.[/QUOTE]
 BTW, ARE you donating your body to science when you die?
 Have you made this aware to others?
 It is your 'choice' though. You willing to force such a thing onto another?
 
 @Duo,
 
 
 The US wouldn't be sacrificing much and our infrastructure in the medical field would still be capable of drawing foreign researchers to our shores to continue their work. We're very adaptable...but, you probably don't realize that or have limited contact with the medical professions.
 The cries of being 'left behind' is fear mongering. Parroting those who don't know and want to capitalise on the issue with government money.
 
 As for medication...Nope, sold them to your momma for sexual services emoticon_rolleyes 
 If you don't like return attacks, just ignore the obvious extreme extrapolation of the situation and position forwarded. Lots of things aren't allowed to happen for various reasons that seem good to one party and daft to another. My desire to repeal assault laws (that have existed for ever) to create jobs is only more laughable than desiring to have someone repeal a ban on cloning for financial reasons.
 And, it seems you couldn't be bothered to even respond to the obviously extreme comment. Should I take that as you're incapable of doing so since you know I'm right and smacking people for advertisement purposes should be allowed and that your dazzled at my inovation that would make me and all those who worked for me wealthy beyond their wildest dreams, just like the telemarketers who call at dinner time ([evil laugh]MuAhahahahahaha[/evil laugh]). Or, that you're too worried that to answer it would hit closer to home and that replying that it's not 'right' to 'harm' another for my financial gain and benefit (even if only mildly) is akin to the percieved harm of cloning a human or experimenting with an embryo is 'harming another' is the eyes of some (even if you disagree).
 
 
No, he is aganist it because of how it destroys life. Never once did he say that he was aganist because of the best interest of the country, but he has said on many occasions that his belief in life is the reason. 

 Really? And you can't possibly imagine him thinking that his beliefs are in the best interest of the US people? Seems like he thinks so...and those who voted him in office...again...do also.
 Just because you think there are flaws with his beliefs and that they possibly don't speak for you doesn't mean that he doesn't think that refusing to destroy life is in the best interest of the country. Maybe you spend a considerable amount of your time talking to the man or listeneing to his speeches to have caught were he said 'I don't believe in destroying life is right but doing so would be in the best interest of my country in regards to embrionic stem cell research.'
 It's the same thing as far as Bush is concerned. His beliefs, to him, are in the best interest of the country. Duh.
 Do you need a 'religious fundy' to Duo_Maxwell tranlational hand book?
 Ask VOR or anyother fundy here if they think their religious beliefs are in the best interest of the country.
 
 [qoute[Are you normally that incoherent?[/quote]
 Are you normally an ignorant *******?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Stem-cell Research and President Bush
